result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Stofflet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 34 jurors called; 1 excused prior to trial.  33 sworn as potential jurors; 18 seated.  Potential jurors #15 and #12 excused; new jurors #15 & #12 seated; 12 jurors selected and sworn to panel.
Exhibits 1-3 marked and received by Court
Signed and Unsigned Verdict Forms, Jury Questions/Answers

9:01 Day 1 of jury trial = State appeared by ADA Troy Cross; Michael Stofflet appeared with Attorney Brian Severson.  Voir dire by Court and counsel.  9:30 Peremptory strikes used; jury of 12 seated and sworn.  9:41 Court in recess/10:08 Court resumed.  Atty Brian Severson requested sequestration; Court granted. Jury entered. Court instructed jury.  10:17 Opening statements by counsel. 10:26 ADA Cross called Robert Howe, sworn. Testimony taken; witness excused, is to remain.  11:00   ADA Cross called David Bourdeau, sworn.  Testimony taken; witness excused, remained under subpoena;.  11:36 ADA Cross  called Officer Schutz, sworn.  Testimony taken; witness excused. 11:48  ADA Cross called Officer Rueth, sworn.  Testimony taken;. witness excused.   11:57 Break for lunch; jury excused.  State requested witnesses be excused; no objection from defendant; Court excused  witnesses.  1:03 pm Court resumed.  State rested.   Atty Severson moved to admit Exhibit 1 and 2; no objection from State.  ADA Cross requested all 3 exhibits be received; Court received all 3 exhibits.  Defendant has elected not to testify.  Court questioned defendant; Court found defendant freely and voluntarily elected not to testify.  Recess for Court to work on jury instructions.  1:24 pm Court resumed.  ADA Cross argued on whether crime or not to be barred.  1:34 pm Jury entered.  Court instructed jury.  1:48 Closing arguments by counsel.  2:25 Bailiffs sworn, jury exited courtroom to begin deliberations.   3:08 Court resumed, inquiry on two questions from jury; Court recessed.  3.:37 pm Court resumed; jury entered.   Court read verdict:  Guilty.  Court polled jurors, jury released.  3:45  Parties ready to proceed to sentencing.  State requested fine/costs $705.00.  Defense does not oppose.  Court found verdict true and correct and judgment entered.  Court imposed fine $705.00 fine/costs due 60 days or payplan.  Jail credit 1 day.  4:05 Court adjourned/
